snippet: President Dilma Rousseff announced Wednesday that the federal government would set aside $1.3 billion to improve bus service in São Paulo.
abstract: Brazilian Pres Dilma Rousseff announces that the federal government will set aside $1.3 billion to improve bus service in Sao Paulo, country’s largest city; June protests over a transit fare increase set off an outburst of national discontent
lead_paragraph: President Dilma Rousseff announced Wednesday that the federal government would set aside $1.3 billion to improve bus service in São Paulo.

headline.main: Brazil President Offers Measure to Try to Untangle Bus Traffic
headline.print_headline: Brazil: President Offers Measure To Try to Untangle Bus Traffic
